title.narrative: Activity 2.4 Sustained media advocacy on long term sustainable alternatives to oil theft and artisanal refining of crude oil in the Niger Delta

description.narrative: This activity was targeted at policy makers, members of the legislature at all levels, youth groups, women groups, community leaders and the general public. Is was further to initiate a dialogue & sensitization between oil producing communities, civil society groups, oil majors and the Nigerian government for workable long term sustainable alternatives to oil theft and Artisanal refining

owner-org.ref: Sustained media advocacy on long term sustainable alternatives to oil theft and artisanal refining of crude oil in the Niger Delta
owner-org.narrative: Activity was implemented by multiple partners but coordinated by the secretariat of NACGOND.

activity-date.narrative: Behavioral change requires series of strategically relayed messages to targeted audience to ensure that, attitude re-formation takes place. This is what this media activity was designed to achieve with series of bulk SMS created to attract empathy from the audience. The same message tune was adopted for the carefully produced short jingles and drama series which were being aired in channels with the widest of audience to reach youths involved in oil theft and artisanal refining of crude oil. Radio discussions had guests from a blend of academia, Civil Society and community experts speak between 30 minutes to 1 hours in an interactive session with the listening audience on burning issues around oil theft and artisanal refining. During discussion times, guests provided evidence based facts on issues around oil theft and artisanal refining mainstreaming its impact on environment and livelihoods of rural people. This link was repeatedly conveyed during implementation of this activity.

organisation.narrative: All inquiries are directed at the National Coordinator.

recipient-country.narrative: This activity took place mostly in Rivers, Bayelsa, Cross River and Akwa Ibom States.

sector.narrative: Policy makers, legislators, youth groups, women groups, community opinion leaders and the general public was targeted during the activity.

condition.narrative: The audience’s level of awareness on issues around oil theft and gas flaring in the Niger Delta with focus on sustainable alternatives to the problem were relayed with reports from feedback channels confirming that, messages were relevant and informative for the targeted audience.

title.narrative: Level of awareness of the listening audience was enhanced to instigate independent action targeted at reducing the extent of youth involvement in oil theft and artisanal refining of crude oil in project communities in the Niger Delta.

description.narrative: Radio live appearances with audience interactive sessions, series of repeated radio jingles and bulk SMS messaging capturing emotive messages, radio drama programmes and use of IEC materials were consistently relayed to the targeted audience.

title.narrative: Number of youths that embraced other income generation options.

description.narrative: As number of youths that take up alternative sources of livelihood aside from oil theft and artisanal refining increases, there would be corresponding reduction in the extent of oil theft that leads to oil spills coming from artisanal refining of crude oil in communities where this activity was implemented across the Niger Delta.
